attributes.action: Create minimum cleanliness standards for British hotels
attributes.additional_details:
Soiled sheets, stained carpets, dirty toilets, broken locks, intermittent water and electricity, filthy headboards, mouldy grout, rising damp, unidentifiable smells....and we, the British consumer, pay a fortune for the 'privilege'.  Dirty hotels are bad for tourism, spread diseases, are a safety risk and are completely unnacceptable.

I urge the HM Government to establish legal minimum cleanliness standards for British Hotels in order to protect the British (and foreign) consumer from being swindled.
